text: Hurricane Audrey was the most powerful June hurricane in the recorded history of the Atlantic since record keeping began. This storm struck Louisiana and Texas, killing more than 500. This hurricane was a very powerful category 3 on the Saffir-Simpson scale. This record was beaten 67 years later by Hurricane Beryl (2024). Category:Hurricanes in the United States Category:Category 3 Atlantic hurricanes Category:1957 in the United States Category:20th century in Louisiana Category:20th century in Texas Category:June events Category:Deadly storms Category:1950s in weather Audrey
title: Hurricane Audrey
